bibl.author: Adamek, Wendi Leigh
bibl.title: Issues in Chinese Buddhist Transmission as Seen Through the Lidai Fabao ji (Record of the Dharma-Jewel Through the Ages)

imprint.publisher: Dept. of Religious Studies of Stanford University

bibl.note: This dissertation is based on Lidai fabao ji, a sectarian history of Buddhism in China composed by the disciples of the monk Wuzhu (714-774), the founder of the Bao Tang school of Chan/Zen in Sichuan. The purpose of the study isto examine problems surrounding Buddhist transmission in China from the 4th-8th centuries. The author compares the Lidai fabao ji version of Buddhist history to other sources to elucidate conceptions of the transmissio of Buddhist authority. She focusses on transmission of the Buddhist precepts and includes a survey of these in the 4-5th centuries.
